alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 8:46PM PST until January 14 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in California... Mad River near Arcata affecting Humboldt County. For the Mad River...including Arcata...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mad River near Arcata. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Severe flooding of all low lying areas near the river from Blue Lake downstream to the mouth. Residents in these areas should be prepared to take appropriate action to protect lives and property. This includes residential areas of Tyee City and the Arcata Bottoms, US Highway 101 near Janes Road, areas near Giuntoli Lane, and Mad River Beach Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM PST Saturday the stage was 27.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM PST Saturday was 27.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 27.7 feet late this evening. It will then fall just below flood stage just after 2AM Sunday morning to 17.0 feet late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.4 feet on 12/22/1955. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 800 AM PST.
